020
021import net.tnemc.core.account.holdings.modify.HoldingsModifier;
022import net.tnemc.core.actions.EconomyResponse;
023import net.tnemc.core.actions.response.GeneralResponse;
024import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.io.maps.MapKey;
025import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
026
027/**
028 * Represents a check that happens during the processing of a {@link Transaction transaction}. These
029 * could be anything from validating balances, to validating inventory space if required.
030 *
031 * @author creatorfromhell
032 * @see Transaction
033 * @since 0.1.2.0
034 */
035public interface TransactionCheck {
036
037  /**
038   * The unique string-based identifier for this check in order to be able to allow control over
039   * what checks are running, and which ones may not have to be utilized. For instance, we don't
040   * want to waste resources with inventory-based checks when it may not involve item-based
041   * currencies.
042   *
043   * @return The unique identifier for this check.
044   */
045  @MapKey
046  String identifier();
047
048  /**
049   * This method is utilized to run the check on the specific transaction. This should return an
050   * {@link EconomyResponse response}.
051   *
052   * @param transaction The {@link Transaction transaction} to perform the check on.
053   *
054   * @return The {@link EconomyResponse response} for this check. This should include a success or
055   * failure boolean along with a message for why it failed if it did. The messages for this
056   * response are ignored if the check was successful.
057   */
058  default EconomyResponse process(final Transaction transaction) {
059
060    if(transaction.getFrom() != null) {
061      final EconomyResponse response = checkParticipant(transaction,
062                                                        transaction.getFrom(),
063                                                        transaction.getModifierFrom());
064
065      if(!response.success()) {
066        return response;
067      }
068    }
069
070    if(transaction.getTo() != null) {
071      final EconomyResponse response = checkParticipant(transaction,
072                                                        transaction.getTo(),
073                                                        transaction.getModifierTo());
074
075      if(!response.success()) {
076        return response;
077      }
078    }
079
080    return GeneralResponse.SUCCESS;
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * This method is utilized to run the check on specific
085   * {@link TransactionParticipant participants}. This should return an
086   * {@link EconomyResponse response}.
087   *
088   * @param transaction The {@link Transaction transaction} to perform the check on.
089   * @param participant The {@link TransactionParticipant participant} to perform the check on.
090   * @param modifier    The {@link HoldingsModifier modifier} related to the specific participant.
091   *
092   * @return The {@link EconomyResponse response} for this check. This should include a success or
093   * failure boolean along with a message for why it failed if it did. The messages for this
094   * response are ignored if the check was successful.
095   */
096  EconomyResponse checkParticipant(Transaction transaction,
097                                   @NotNull TransactionParticipant participant,
098                                   HoldingsModifier modifier);
099}
